article.title: Army Modifies Air and Missile Defense Battle Command System Contract
article.text: Northrop Grumman Information Systems, Huntsville, Alabama, was awarded a $7,300,000 cost-plus-incentive-fee funding modification contract for the integrated air and missile defense battle command system contract. Work will be performed in Huntsville, Alabama, with an estimated completion date of Sept. 30, 2016. Bids were solicited via the Internet with one received. Fiscal 2015 research, development, test and evaluation funds in the amount of $7,300,000 are being obligated at the time of the award. The Army Contracting Command, Redstone Arsenal, Alabama, is the contracting activity (W31P4Q-08-C-0418).
